sndlib.core.network
Class AdmissiblePath

java.lang.Object
  sndlib.core.network.AdmissiblePath

public final class AdmissiblePath
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents a single admissible path for a Demand.

In SNDlib a path is formulated by a sequence of Links.

For constructing a new AdmissiblePath a parent Network and a parent Demand is needed.

An AdmissiblePath maintains the following invariants:

  • all links in the path are contained in the parent network of its parent demand
  • if a link is removed from the parent network of the path's parent demand, then all occurences of that link will be also removed from the path.
    If the path is empty after removing a link then that path will be removed from its parent demand.
Whether or not an AdmissiblePath is really a path, depends among others on the network Model, and is not checked by this class itself.

Author:
Roman Klaehne
See Also:
Demand, Network.newAdmissiblePath(String, List, Demand)

links

public java.util.List<Link> links()
Returns a Collection view of the links in this path.

The returned collection is unmodifiable. That means that each attempt to modify the collection will cause an UnsupportedOperationException.
